p: The number of medicinal plants used per informant is 1.94, value comprised between those found in Alt Empordà and Montseny (Table 2). A much higher value was obtained for the Segarra district, an area close to the Garrigues. However, this difference must be interpreted with caution, because it may be a bias partially due to the number of the informants interviewed (29 compared to 101). Medicinal plants per habitant are 0.88 × 10 −2, a value similar to those recorded in Cerdanya or Ripollès (Table 2). Finally, medicinal plants per area are 0.17, a value near the one of Pallars, and lower than in other studied areas, like Montseny or Alt Empordà (Table 2).
